Package com.mhealthatlas.enterpriseapps.controller

Class PortfolioCommandController

java.lang.Object
com.mhealthatlas.enterpriseapps.controller.PortfolioCommandController
@Controller
@RequestMapping("/enterprise-apps")
public class PortfolioCommandController
extends java.lang.Object
PortfolioCommandController is the class containing all API endpoints for mutating portfolio data.

  • Method Details

    • postPortfolio

      @PostMapping("/enterprises/{enterprise}/portfolios") @ResponseStatus(CREATED) @ResponseBody public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.Long> postPortfolio​(@PathVariable java.lang.String enterprise, @RequestBody PortfolioCommandDto portfolio, org.springframework.security.core.Authentication authentication)
      Creates a new portfolio.

      The method can be invoked with an HTTP POST request calling /enterprises/{enterprise}/portfolios

      Only users who are members of the specified enterprise can access the API endpoint.

      Parameters:
      enterprise - the enterprise name; not null; request path parameter
      portfolio - the portfolio data; not null; required request body parameter
      authentication - the authentication object, injected by spring security
      Returns:
      201 CREATED response containing the portfolio id, if the user is a member of the enterprise and the portfolio was created successfully;
      422 UNPROCESSABLE_ENTITY response if the user is a member of the enterprise and the given portfolio data is invalid;
      403 FORBIDDEN response otherwise;

    • updatePortfolio

      @PostMapping("/enterprises/{enterprise}/portfolios/{portfolioId}") @ResponseStatus(OK) @ResponseBody public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.Void> updatePortfolio​(@PathVariable java.lang.String enterprise, @PathVariable java.lang.Long portfolioId, @RequestBody PortfolioCommandDto portfolio, org.springframework.security.core.Authentication authentication)
      Updates an existing portfolio.

      The method can be invoked with an HTTP POST request calling /enterprises/{enterprise}/portfolios/{portfolioId}

      Only users who are members of the specified enterprise can access the API endpoint.

      Parameters:
      enterprise - the enterprise name; not null; request path parameter
      portfolioId - the portfolio id; not null; request path parameter
      portfolio - the portfolio data; not null; required request body parameter
      authentication - the authentication object, injected by spring security
      Returns:
      200 OK response, if the user is a member of the enterprise and the portfolio was updated successfully;
      422 UNPROCESSABLE_ENTITY response if the user is a member of the enterprise and the given portfolio data is invalid or the the existing portfolio was not found;
      403 FORBIDDEN response otherwise;

    • deletePortfolio

      @DeleteMapping("/enterprises/{enterprise}/portfolios/{portfolioId}") @ResponseStatus(OK) @ResponseBody public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.Void> deletePortfolio​(@PathVariable java.lang.String enterprise, @PathVariable java.lang.Long portfolioId, org.springframework.security.core.Authentication authentication)
      Deletes an existing portfolio.

      The method can be invoked with an HTTP DELETE request calling /enterprises/{enterprise}/portfolios/{portfolioId}

      Only users who are members of the specified enterprise can access the API endpoint.

      Parameters:
      enterprise - the enterprise name; not null; request path parameter
      portfolioId - the portfolio id; not null; request path parameter
      authentication - the authentication object, injected by spring security
      Returns:
      200 OK response, if the user is a member of the enterprise and the portfolio was deleted successfully;
      422 UNPROCESSABLE_ENTITY response if the user is a member of the enterprise and the the existing portfolio was not found;
      403 FORBIDDEN response otherwise;

    • postPortfolioClass

      @PostMapping("/enterprises/{enterprise}/portfolios/{portfolioId}/classes") @ResponseStatus(CREATED) @ResponseBody public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.Long> postPortfolioClass​(@PathVariable java.lang.String enterprise, @PathVariable java.lang.Long portfolioId, @RequestBody InsertPortfolioClassDto portfolioClass, org.springframework.security.core.Authentication authentication)
      Inserts a new portfolio class.

      The method can be invoked with an HTTP POST request calling /enterprises/{enterprise}/portfolios/{portfolioId}/classes

      Only users who are members of the specified enterprise can access the API endpoint.

      Parameters:
      enterprise - the enterprise name; not null; request path parameter
      portfolioId - the portfolio id; not null; request path parameter
      portfolioClass - the portfolio class data; not null; required request body parameter
      authentication - the authentication object, injected by spring security
      Returns:
      201 CREATED response, if the user is a member of the enterprise and the portfolio class was created successfully;
      422 UNPROCESSABLE_ENTITY response if the user is a member of the enterprise and the the portfolio was not found or the portfolio class is invalid;
      403 FORBIDDEN response otherwise;

    • updatePortfolioClass

      @PostMapping("/enterprises/{enterprise}/portfolios/{portfolioId}/classes/{portfolioClassId}") @ResponseStatus(OK) @ResponseBody public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.Void> updatePortfolioClass​(@PathVariable java.lang.String enterprise, @PathVariable java.lang.Long portfolioId, @PathVariable java.lang.Long portfolioClassId, @RequestBody UpdatePortfolioClassDto portfolioClass, org.springframework.security.core.Authentication authentication)
      Updates an existing portfolio class.

      The method can be invoked with an HTTP POST request calling /enterprises/{enterprise}/portfolios/{portfolioId}/classes/{portfolioClassId}

      Only users who are members of the specified enterprise can access the API endpoint.

      Parameters:
      enterprise - the enterprise name; not null; request path parameter
      portfolioId - the portfolio id; not null; request path parameter
      portfolioClassId - the portfolio class id; not null; request path parameter
      portfolioClass - the portfolio class data; not null; required request body parameter
      authentication - the authentication object, injected by spring security
      Returns:
      200 OK response, if the user is a member of the enterprise and the portfolio class was updated successfully;
      422 UNPROCESSABLE_ENTITY response if the user is a member of the enterprise and the existing portfolio class was not found or the portfolio class is invalid;
      403 FORBIDDEN response otherwise;

    • deletePortfolioClass

      @DeleteMapping("/enterprises/{enterprise}/portfolios/{portfolioId}/classes/{portfolioClassId}") @ResponseStatus(OK) @ResponseBody public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.Void> deletePortfolioClass​(@PathVariable java.lang.String enterprise, @PathVariable java.lang.Long portfolioId, @PathVariable java.lang.Long portfolioClassId, org.springframework.security.core.Authentication authentication)
      Deletes an existing portfolio class.

      The method can be invoked with an HTTP DELETE request calling /enterprises/{enterprise}/portfolios/{portfolioId}/classes/{portfolioClassId}

      Only users who are members of the specified enterprise can access the API endpoint.

      Parameters:
      enterprise - the enterprise name; not null; request path parameter
      portfolioId - the portfolio id; not null; request path parameter
      portfolioClassId - the portfolio class id; not null; request path parameter
      authentication - the authentication object, injected by spring security
      Returns:
      200 OK response, if the user is a member of the enterprise and the portfolio class was deleted successfully;
      422 UNPROCESSABLE_ENTITY response if the user is a member of the enterprise and the existing portfolio class was not found;
      403 FORBIDDEN response otherwise;

    • insertPortfolioClassApplicationMapping

      @PostMapping("/enterprises/{enterprise}/portfolios/{portfolioId}/classes/{portfolioClassId}/apps/{appId}") @ResponseStatus(CREATED) @ResponseBody public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.Void> insertPortfolioClassApplicationMapping​(@PathVariable java.lang.String enterprise, @PathVariable java.lang.Long portfolioId, @PathVariable java.lang.Long portfolioClassId, @PathVariable java.lang.Long appId, org.springframework.security.core.Authentication authentication)
      Inserts a new portfolio class mHealthAtlas application mapping.

      The method can be invoked with an HTTP POST request calling /enterprises/{enterprise}/portfolios/{portfolioId}/classes/{portfolioClassId}/apps/{appId}

      Only users who are members of the specified enterprise can access the API endpoint.

      Parameters:
      enterprise - the enterprise name; not null; request path parameter
      portfolioId - the portfolio id; not null; request path parameter
      portfolioClassId - the portfolio class id; not null; request path parameter
      appId - the mHealthAtlas application id; not null; request path parameter
      authentication - the authentication object, injected by spring security
      Returns:
      201 CREATED response, if the user is a member of the enterprise and the mHealthAtlas Application is assigned to the portfolio class successfully;
      422 UNPROCESSABLE_ENTITY response if the user is a member of the enterprise and the portfolio class was not found;
      403 FORBIDDEN response otherwise;

    • deletePortfolioClassApplicationMapping

      @DeleteMapping("/enterprises/{enterprise}/portfolios/{portfolioId}/classes/{portfolioClassId}/apps/{appId}") @ResponseStatus(OK) @ResponseBody public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.Void> deletePortfolioClassApplicationMapping​(@PathVariable java.lang.String enterprise, @PathVariable java.lang.Long portfolioId, @PathVariable java.lang.Long portfolioClassId, @PathVariable java.lang.Long appId, org.springframework.security.core.Authentication authentication)
      Deletes a portfolio class mHealthAtlas application mapping.

      The method can be invoked with an HTTP Delete request calling /enterprises/{enterprise}/portfolios/{portfolioId}/classes/{portfolioClassId}/apps/{appId}

      Only users who are members of the specified enterprise can access the API endpoint.

      Parameters:
      enterprise - the enterprise name; not null; request path parameter
      portfolioId - the portfolio id; not null; request path parameter
      portfolioClassId - the portfolio class id; not null; request path parameter
      appId - the mHealthAtlas application id; not null; request path parameter
      authentication - the authentication object, injected by spring security
      Returns:
      200 OK response, if the user is a member of the enterprise and the mHealthAtlas Application is removed from the portfolio class successfully;
      422 UNPROCESSABLE_ENTITY response if the user is a member of the enterprise and the portfolio class was not found;
      403 FORBIDDEN response otherwise;

    • postApplicationVersionAnnotation

      @PostMapping("/enterprises/{enterprise}/apps/{appType}/{appVersionId}/annotations") @ResponseStatus(CREATED) @ResponseBody public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.Long> postApplicationVersionAnnotation​(@PathVariable java.lang.String enterprise, @PathVariable AppType appType, @PathVariable java.lang.Long appVersionId, @RequestBody InsertAppVersionAnnotationDto appVersionAnnotation, org.springframework.security.core.Authentication authentication)
      Inserts a new application version annotation.

      The method can be invoked with an HTTP POST request calling /enterprises/{enterprise}/apps/{appType}/{appVersionId}/annotations

      Only users who are members of the specified enterprise can access the API endpoint.

      Parameters:
      enterprise - the enterprise name; not null; request path parameter
      appType - the application type; not null; request path parameter
      appVersionId - the application version id; not null; request path parameter
      appVersionAnnotation - the annotation data; not null; request path parameter
      authentication - the authentication object, injected by spring security
      Returns:
      201 CREATED response, if the user is a member of the enterprise and the annotation is created successfully;
      422 UNPROCESSABLE_ENTITY response if the user is a member of the enterprise and the application version was not found;
      403 FORBIDDEN response otherwise;

    • updateApplicationVersionAnnotation

      @PostMapping("/enterprises/{enterprise}/apps/{appType}/{appVersionId}/annotations/{id}") @ResponseStatus(OK) @ResponseBody public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.Void> updateApplicationVersionAnnotation​(@PathVariable java.lang.String enterprise, @PathVariable AppType appType, @PathVariable java.lang.Long appVersionId, @PathVariable java.lang.Long id, @RequestBody UpdateAppVersionAnnotationDto appVersionAnnotation, org.springframework.security.core.Authentication authentication)
      Updates an existing application version annotation.

      The method can be invoked with an HTTP POST request calling /enterprises/{enterprise}/apps/{appType}/{appVersionId}/annotations/{id}

      Only users who are members of the specified enterprise can access the API endpoint.

      Parameters:
      enterprise - the enterprise name; not null; request path parameter
      appType - the application type; not null; request path parameter
      appVersionId - the application version id; not null; request path parameter
      id - the application version annotation id; not null; request path parameter
      appVersionAnnotation - the annotation data; not null; request path parameter
      authentication - the authentication object, injected by spring security
      Returns:
      200 OK response, if the user is a member of the enterprise and the annotation is updated successfully;
      422 UNPROCESSABLE_ENTITY response if the user is a member of the enterprise and the application version existing annotation was not found;
      403 FORBIDDEN response otherwise;

    • deleteApplicationVersionAnnotation

      @DeleteMapping("/enterprises/{enterprise}/apps/{appType}/{appVersionId}/annotations/{id}") @ResponseStatus(OK) @ResponseBody public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.Void> deleteApplicationVersionAnnotation​(@PathVariable java.lang.String enterprise, @PathVariable AppType appType, @PathVariable java.lang.Long appVersionId, @PathVariable java.lang.Long id, org.springframework.security.core.Authentication authentication)
      Deletes an existing application version annotation.

      The method can be invoked with an HTTP DELETE request calling /enterprises/{enterprise}/apps/{appType}/{appVersionId}/annotations/{id}

      Only users who are members of the specified enterprise can access the API endpoint.

      Parameters:
      enterprise - the enterprise name; not null; request path parameter
      appType - the application type; not null; request path parameter
      appVersionId - the application version id; not null; request path parameter
      id - the application version annotation id; not null; request path parameter
      authentication - the authentication object, injected by spring security
      Returns:
      200 OK response, if the user is a member of the enterprise and the annotation is deleted successfully;
      422 UNPROCESSABLE_ENTITY response if the user is a member of the enterprise and the application version annotation was not found;
